data.title: Morris: Include Tobagonians in autonomy discussion
data.description: Tobago House of Assembly (THA) Minority Leader Kelvon Morris is warning that if a May 22 motion listed for debate at the legislature is passed, Tobagonians will lose control of Tobago’s future. The motion tabled by Chief Secretary Farley Augustine, calls on the government, through the Attorney General and the Chief Parliamentary Counsel, to work with the THA to expand its legislative and regulatory authority over key areas in the Fifth Schedule, and to draft the necessary legal amendments in collaboration with the THA’s legal team. It also wants government to review all previous versions of the Tobago autonomy bills with input from the THA, identify areas of consensus and refinement, and reintroduce the bills in Parliament at the shortest possible period. When passed, the Chief Secretary is to transmit this motion and a supporting policy paper to the Prime Minister at the earliest opportunity following its passage. But Morris during a press conference at his Scarborough office on May 21 begged to differ. “This isn’t autonomy that the Chief Secretary is about to deliver to the people of Tobago, but it is really about a high-jack of Tobago’s voice, the people’s voice. And it is an absolute betrayal of everything Mr Farley Chavez Augustine once claimed to believe in.” He delved into the motion, which he said might be well-meaning and sounding decent. “The motion now before the assembly gives the cabinet in Port of Spain the power to draft changes to the THA Act with absolutely no requirement to consult with you the people of Tobago. No public meetings and no obligation to return to Tobagonians for its approval.” He said Augustine was the same man who once blasted the autonomy bills for lacking consultation, even accusing others of being dictatorial writing to the then prime minister and opposition leader asking them to reject the bills. “This same Farley Chavez Augustine is now pushing a process that is even worse. He is doing exactly what he condemned.” In December 2024, Augustine said a committee would be set up to consult with Tobagonians. He said as far as he could recall, the committee was appointed. “I know in the electoral district of Darryl Spring/ Whim, there has been no such consultation. Therefore, on a matter that is so important to the well-being of the average Tobagonians, I am asking you today, fellow Tobagonians, whether you are comfortable with a process that excludes your input, that denies you the right to have a say as to what the autonomy, your right to self-determination should be.” He added: “This is betrayal, this is betrayal of the trust of every Tobagonian. This fight is not abstract, it affects real issues like where you can get legal titles to the lands you currently live on for generations, whether Tobago will get its fair share of the national budget consistently and constitutionally. "These are the very powers and decisions that your chief secretary Mr Farley Augustine is putting on the table without even asking you the people of Tobago.” Morris has penned a letter to Augustine outlining the said concerns, as he is calling on him to withdraw the motion. He said the people of Tobago should be consulted before a decision like this is made. He is also writing to all the parties that would have participated in the April 28 General Elections, all political interest groups, the civic groups, the chambers and youth organisations to join him in the call. “It is not for any cabinet in Port of Spain to say to us here in Tobago what our configuration of the relationship should be. Ultimately this is a conversation that must be had with both Tobagonians and Trinidadians because this is a relationship. Therefore, to exclude the people out of an issue that is so fundamental to the well-being of a people." The post Morris: Include Tobagonians in autonomy discussion appeared first on Trinidad and Tobago Newsday .

He is doing exactly what he condemned.” In December 2024, Augustine said a committee would be set up to consult with Tobagonians. He said as far as he could recall, the committee was appointed. “I know in the electoral district of Darryl Spring/ Whim, there has been no such consultation. Therefore, on a matter that is so important to the well-being of the average Tobagonians, I am asking you today, fellow Tobagonians, whether you are comfortable with a process that excludes your input, that denies you the right to have a say as to what the autonomy, your right to self-determination should be.” He added: “This is betrayal, this is betrayal of the trust of every Tobagonian. This fight is not abstract, it affects real issues like where you can get legal titles to the lands you currently live on for generations, whether Tobago will get its fair share of the national budget consistently and constitutionally. "These are the very powers and decisions that your chief secretary Mr Farley Augustine is putting on the table without even asking you the people of Tobago.” Morris has penned a letter to Augustine outlining the said concerns, as he is calling on him to withdraw the motion. He said the people of Tobago should be consulted before a decision like this is made. He is also writing to all the parties that would have participated in the April 28 General Elections, all political interest groups, the civic groups, the chambers and youth organisations to join him in the call. “It is not for any cabinet in Port of Spain to say to us here in Tobago what our configuration of the relationship should be. Ultimately this is a conversation that must be had with both Tobagonians and Trinidadians because this is a relationship. Therefore, to exclude the people out of an issue that is so fundamental to the well-being of a people." The post Morris: Include Tobagonians in autonomy discussion appeared first on Trinidad and Tobago Newsday .

data.title: Ratiram: Cocoa farming may be a goldmine
data.description: AGRICULTURE Minister Ravi Ratiram yearned for TT to return to its glory days of cocoa production, describing it now as a potential goldmine for farmers that can help to diversify the country’s economy. He gave the feature address at the Cocoa Research Centre (CRC) Annual Research and Development Symposium held at the University of the West Indies, St Augustine, on May 21. The conference theme was building sustainability and resilience in the cocoa value chain. Ratiram hailed the CRC’s commitment to research, innovation and sustainability. He said the conference theme resonated deeply with the idea of diversifying the TT economy and strengthening the agricultural value chain. The minister said was more than just a crop but was also a cultural and economic legacy. He touted TT’s Trinitaro strain, that he said was a hybrid of the Creolo and Forestero strains. “In the 1920s cocoa was a leading export, employing tens of thousands of people.” Ratiram said TT at its peak had produced 30,000 tones of cocoa per year. Today it was just 500 tons annually, he lamented. “The cocoa industry needs revitalisation,” Ratiram said. He said, historically, the cocoa industry had declined after infection by diseases known as Witch’s Broom and Black Pod Disease. Ratiram said the local cocoa industry had been hit by declines in farmers’ confidence, estates’ productivity and export earnings. “For too long, the cocoa industry has teetered on the edge of irrelevance. “But today with collaboration, we stand on the threshold of opportunity.” He lauded support to the sector offered by the Cocoa Investment Fund. “We have to encourage our young ones to get involved in this potential goldmine that exists in TT.” He said the industry’s recovery could be based on a scientific backbone. “Bridge the gap between research and application, so findings reach the farmers’ fields.” He urged all present to commit to cocoa restoring TT’s economy. “Let us cultivate not just cocoa but a legacy of pride for all stakeholders in the industry.” The conference also received welcome remarks from campus principal Prof Rose-Marie Belle Antoine and CRC director Prof Pathmanathan Umaharan. Dr Peri Tobias, a research fellow from the University of Sydney (Australia) gave the guest lecture, on the topic of resistance to vascular streak dieback (VSD), an infection hitting cocoa plants in places like Papua New Guinea. The post Ratiram: Cocoa farming may be a goldmine appeared first on Trinidad and Tobago Newsday .

data.title: Minister: Cost being assessed to remediate Debe campus
data.description: MINISTER of Tertiary Education Prakash Persad reacted to questions about the required remediation of the proposed Debe campus of the University of the West Indies (UWI), by saying that costs were still being calculated, speaking to Newsday on May 21. The day before Energy Minister and Oropouche East MP Dr Roodal Moonilal toured the site which he complained had been left unoccupied and left in a state of disrepair, despite its initial price-tag of $600 million. It was originally built starting in 2012 to house a Faculty of Law, but in 2019 was then chosen to facilitate a Faculty of Medicine and most recently been designated to become a Global School of Medicine (GSM) for international students pursuing a Doctor of Medicine (MD) degree. The latest news was that at least one course was supposed to begin there in August. Newsday asked Persad what were his hopes for the site, what was the expected cost of remediation, and how much work had to be done and within what expected time-line. He replied, "What I can tell you is the process now is that the costing is being evaluated and that is in progress. "It will take a week or two and only then can I say something on it. To build the campus up, it is being evaluated now." Newsday asked about any expected time-line for works. Persad replied, "It would be premature to give time-lines and costs. It is still being worked on." He added, "It has been lying there for some time, so maybe they do a proper evaluation. When they have done that, I will make a press release. I don't want to comment on anything yet." Newsday sent a text to Moonilal asking his hopes for the site in terms of the cost and time for remediation but up to press time got no reply. Newsday asked Finance Minister Davendranath Tancoo if he has allocated any funds for the remediation but by press time got no reply. Newsday sent a text to former education minister Dr Nyan Gadsby-Dolly over claims her administration had neglected the site, but as of press time got no reply. The post Minister: Cost being assessed to remediate Debe campus appeared first on Trinidad and Tobago Newsday .

data.title: Padarath rages at ODPM, warns about 'Hurricane Barry'
data.description: Public Utilities Minister Barry Padarath has criticised the Office of Disaster Preparedness and Management (ODPM), among other state agencies, for their responsiveness in the face of disasters. But ODPM CEO Ret'd Maj Gen Rodney Smart believes Padarath was misguided on the role of the organisation when he criticised it. Speaking at the TT Meteorological Service's (TTMS) National Climate Outlook Forum at the TT Civil Aviation Authority's Piarco headquarters on May 21, Padarath said, “Over the years I have not been satisfied, nor have I been happy, with the response of some of these critical stakeholders and one of those has been the ODPM.” With Smart sitting metres away at the head table, Padarath accused agency officials of “sitting in ivory towers” while the public struggles to come to terms with the consequences of whatever the disaster may be. “There must be a greater degree of responsiveness. I know the reality on the ground. I know what the response has been from organisations, and I will not apologise for saying ODPM has to become more responsive and understand what the challenges are when we have significant rainfall.” He said, as the MP of a constituency with large swathes of rural areas, he has witnessed, first-hand, how lethargic state agencies can be in their response to floods and other natural disasters. “I recall stakeholders coming to Princes Town and providing platitudes at a time when you needed a greater degree of responsiveness. And that is what citizens of TT expect, responsiveness. “While I understand there will be limitations form time to time there is a certain degree of responsiveness that is needed in terms of immediacy and how you treat with these matters.” Padarath said citizens believe there is a disconnect between them and state agencies and added this must be addressed. He said there must be a paradigm shift so those who are most affected feel as though their needs are being met. “For far too long we have had government and ambits of the state that are sitting in air-conditioned comfort, not understanding what the reality on the ground is. The electorate requires us to have a greater degree of connectivity with communities and constituencies and ultimately with the entire country.” He accused the ODPM and the other state agencies of lacking the will power to get things done. “I can say safely that I am not comfortable with the responsiveness and the work. One may say it is funding, the other I will say it is the will. I have been very hands on as MP and now as Minister to understand the challenges, and funding is just part of the problem. The other part has to do with the will and urgency to treat with some of these matters.” Padarath warned state agencies he will be monitoring their operations at every level and said he is willing to get his hands dirty. “Two weeks from now we will kick off the hurricane season and I want to warn you that one of the hurricanes you could expect, his name is Barry. We are yet to see the impact in terms of how significant he will be but however I give you the assurance I intend on being a very hands-on minister. “Whether I get flack or not, it is much needed in a sector that affects people every single day of their lives with water, communication, electricity, weather. These are critical areas that impact people’s pockets and homes.” Smart defends ODPM, not worried about his job Meanwhile, speaking with the media during a break at the forum, Smart suggested Padarath’s comments was based on a misunderstanding of the local disaster response system. “When he was speaking to responsiveness, it appeared he was speaking to what one would expect, in our national disaster system, from the Ministry of Rural Development and Local Government (MRDLG).” Smart explained the first response in any situation is at the community level with the MRDLG, as well as the TT Fire Service. “These are the authorities that respond immediately. In the case of Tobago is the Tobago Emergency Management Agency. So that when they find that their resources are insufficient or when they don't have a capability, then they reach out to the ODPM. That is when the ODPM gets involved.” He added the ODPM serves more of a co-ordinating role, while constantly monitoring the situation and offering help if agencies appear to be overwhelmed. “The ODPM cannot get involved unless there is a request for support. But mind you, the ODPM is all the time, always monitoring and reaching out. So the responsiveness that he spoke to is built into the system.” Asked if he was worried about his tenure being cut short based on Padarath’s comments, Smart defended his work at the ODPM and said his employment status was not his main concern. “My contract ends later this year. If it is that the government's view is that they would like to renew it, or not, that's fine. “I took a contract for three years and at the end it is either going to be renewed or not renewed. But my job is not to worry about a contract. My job is to ensure that while I am there, I give the best professional service as possible.” He said he was not worried about being politically targeted as he was not a political appointee. “To become the CEO of the ODPM you have to go through the (recruitment) process like every single person in the ODPM who is employed. So you have to go through a competitive process and based on the process, if you come out on top, you are the person hired. “My purpose is to serve TT and to support any administration that comes into power. That's my job. And that's the job of all the people in the ODPM. The ODPM will always be supportive of whichever administration is in power.” Smart said he approached Padarath during a break at the forum and in a cordial chat with him, offered to explain the ODPM’s role. “ I told him, ‘Minister I would like to meet with you and brief you so you are aware of the (disaster response) system.’” Asked if Padarath appeared willing to meet with him, Smart said, “He didn’t say no, so I assume he was receptive to what I had to say.” Hurricane Barry bears down on state agencies This is not Padarath’s first public comment on the operations at state agencies since his appointment as minister on May 3. Last week, he ordered majority state-owned Telecommunications Services of TT (TSTT) and its subsidiary, Amplia, to put a freeze on all human resource actions after the board’s failure to resign in the wake of the UNC’s election victory over the PNM. It has become customary that appointees to state boards resign when governments change. Given the board’s failure to resign, Padarath directed TSTT CEO Kent Western not to act on any decisions made at the board-level until a new board is installed. The five board members, Annalean Inniss, Angelo Austin, Cavelle Joseph-St Omer, Wendell Berkley and chairman Anthony Peyson eventually resigned on May 14. His comments on the operations of Water and Sewerage Authority (WASA) also garnered national attention after he announced his intention to scrap WASA’s transformation plan implemented by former minister Marvin Gonzales. Speaking after Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar ripped up a copy of the plan at a post-cabinet news conference on May 15, Padarath said the plan resulted in a top-heavy management structure. He claimed under the PNM, there was a focus on big jobs "for the boys and girls in the party" and noted there are 34 executive positions with combined salaries of over $74 million.u The post Padarath rages at ODPM, warns about 'Hurricane Barry' appeared first on Trinidad and Tobago Newsday .

data.title: Buffett o stalnoj dilemi - nekretnine ili dionice: Za pet minuta možete uraditi poslove vrijedne milijarde
data.description: Jackie Han je prisustvovao godišnjoj skupštini dioničara investicijskog konglomerata Berkshire Hathaway koji je održan ranije ovaj mjesec u Omahi.
data.translatedTitle: Buffett about permanent dilemma - real estate or shares: In five minutes you can do jobs worth billions
data.translatedDescription: Jackie Han attended the annual assembly of the shareholder of the investment conglomerate Berksshire Hathaway, which was held earlier this month in Omahi.

data.title: Estonian Embassy in London puts on fashion show to raise funds for Ukraine
data.description: Last week, the Estonian Embassy in London organized the charity event #Walk4Ukraine, raising more than £50,000 (€60,000) to support Ukraine. The event included a fashion show and a dinner with an auction for 150 guests at Christ Church Spitalfields in central London.
data.translatedTitle: Estonian Embassy in London puts on fashion show to raise funds for Ukraine
data.translatedDescription: Last week, the Estonian Embassy in London organized the charity event #Walk4Ukraine, raising more than £50,000 (€60,000) to support Ukraine. The event included a fashion show and a dinner with an auction for 150 guests at Christ Church Spitalfields in central London.

data.title: UUS TREND ⟩ Miks lähevad korteriühistud üle kaugküttele?
data.description: Gaasi hinna volatiilsus ning soov tagada hea varustuskindlus motiveerib korteriühistuid üha enam liituma kaugküttega. Kaks kaugküttega liitunud Tallinna korteriühistu esindajat jagavad enda kogemusi, kuidas protsess välja näeb ning kui palju see ühistule maksma võib minna.
data.translatedTitle: New trend⟩ Why are apartment associations switching to district heating?
data.translatedDescription: The volatility of the gas price and the desire to ensure good security of supply motivates the apartment associations to join district heating. Two representatives of the Tallinn Housing Association, who have joined the district heating, share their experience of how the process looks like and how much it can cost the cooperative.

data.title: Washingtonis toimunud tulistamises hukkusid kaks Iisraeli saatkonna töötajat
data.description: Washingtonis toimunud tulistamises hukkusid kaks Iisraeli saatkonna töötajat, sellest teatas USA sisejulgeolekuminister Kristi Noem.
data.translatedTitle: Two employees of the Israeli Embassy were killed in a shooting in Washington
data.translatedDescription: Two Israeli Embassy employees were killed in a shooting in Washington, which was announced by US Minister of Internal Security Kristi Noem.

data.title: See ülipopulaarne tegevus häirib stjuardesse silmapilkselt – ja see ei ole see, mida arvad olevat
data.description: Kui reisijad hakkavad unustama elementaarseid käitumisreegleid, võib kogu lennukogemus muutuda ebameeldivaks nii kaasreisijatele kui ka meeskonnale.Viimasel ajal on lennusaatjad ja lennunduseksperdid hakanud sotsiaalmeedias üha sagedamini jagama juhtumeid reisijatest, kes rikuvad käitumisnorme – tihti teadmatusest, mõnikord ka lihtsalt hoolimatusest. Üks neist tavapärasematest, kuid pahameelt tekitavatest harjumustest on istekohavahetus ilma loata, mida paljud peavad tühiseks, kuid mis võib tegelikkuses mõjutada lennu turvalisust ja sujuvust. Kuid mis on need teised asjad, mis samuti pardameeskonda ja teisi reisijaid häirivad?
data.translatedTitle: This ultra -popular activity disturbs the stewardly instantly - and that's not what you think
data.translatedDescription: As passengers begin to forget the basic rules of conduct, all airline experience may become unpleasant for both fellow travelers and teams. In the last time, flight attendants and aviation experts have increasingly begun to share cases of passengers who violate behavioral standards - often ignorance, sometimes simply neglect. One of these more common but annoying habits is a change of seating without permission, which many consider it negligible, but which can actually affect flight security and smoothness. But what are the other things that also disturb the boarding team and other passengers?

data.title: RAHVA VIHA ⟩ Jaapani põllumajandusminister astus tagasi, kuna ütles, et saab riisi tasuta
data.description: Jaapani põllumajandusminister astus tagasi pärast seda, kui ütles, et ei osta kunagi riisi, kuna saab selle tasuta. See märkus tekitas avalikkuses pahameelt riigis, kus toiduainete hinnad on tõusnud.
data.translatedTitle: People's anger⟩ Japanese Minister of Agriculture resigned because he said he could get rice for free
data.translatedDescription: The Japanese Minister of Agriculture resigned after he said he would never buy rice because he would be free. This note caused resentment in the public in the country where food prices have risen.

data.title: Netanyahu: tapsime tõenäoliselt Hamasi juhi
data.description: Iisraeli peaminister Benjamin Netanyahu ütles kolmapäeval peetud pressikonverentsil, et Iisrael on tõenäoliselt tapnud Mohammed Sinwari, kes on Hamasi liider Gazas, vahendas CNN.
data.translatedTitle: Netanyahu: We probably killed Hamas driver
data.translatedDescription: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said at a press conference on Wednesday that Israel has probably killed Mohammed Sinwari, who is Hamasi's leader in Gaza, CNN said.

data.title: Maasikakilo hind võib jääda mullusele tasemele
data.description: Kesk-Eestis Järvamaal teiste põllukultuuride kõrval ka maasikaid kasvatava Lõhmuse mahetalu peremees Janno Lõhmus pani inimestele südamele mitte lasta end mõjutada kõlavatest pealkirjadest, vaid lähtuda ennekõike talupojamõistusest.
data.translatedTitle: The price of a kilo of strawberry may remain at last year's level
data.translatedDescription: In addition to other crops in Järva County in Central Estonia, Janno Lõhmus, the owner of Lõhmus Organic Farm, which cultivates strawberries, put people in the heart not to be influenced by sounding headlines, but primarily to follow the peasant mind.

data.title: Uued ja põnevad viljapuud Eesti aedades
data.description: Globaalne kliimasoojenemine, millest iganes see siis ka tingitud ei ole, on meie talved ilmselgelt hambutumaks muutnud ning seda aega aastast, mille jaoks õiget aastaaja nimetust ei oskagi valida, on ikka rohkem: sügis justkui enam ei ole, aga talv veel ka mitte. data.title: Сборная Таджикистана по кикбоксингу завоевала 36 медалей на Кубке мира WAKO
data.description: Сборная Таджикистана по кикбоксингу завоевала 7 золотых, 12 серебряных, 17 бронзовых медалей на Кубке мира WAKO в Анталье, прошедшем 15-18 мая.    В турнире приняли участие 2767 спортсменов из 93 клубов и 43 стран мира, сообщили «Азия-Плюс» в Федерации кикбоксинга (WAKO) Таджикистана (ФКТ).
data.translatedTitle: Tajikistan Kikboxing team won 36 medals at the Wako World Cup
data.translatedDescription: The Tajik team in kickboxing won 7 gold, 12 silver, 17 bronze medals at the WAKO World Cup in Antalya, held on May 15-18.    The tournament was attended by 2767 athletes from 93 clubs and 43 countries of the world, Tajikistan (FKT) was told by Asia-Plus (WAKO).

data.title: Ҳалокати писарбачаи 2-сола дар кӯдакистони Душанбе. Мураббӣ боздошт шуд
data.description: Дар яке аз кӯдакистонҳои хусусии пойтахт писарбачаи 2-сола ҳалок шуд. Бино ба маълумоти  Раёсати ВКД  дар шаҳри Душанбе ин ҳодисаи фоҷеабор рӯзи 19 май рух додааст: кӯдак дар панҷараи ошёнаи 2-юми рахти хоб овезон шуда, ба ҳалокат расидааст.
data.translatedTitle: 2-year-old boy's death in Monday childhood. Coach detained
data.translatedDescription: 2-year-old boy killed in one of the capital's private kindergartens. According to the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the fact of the tragedy was occurred on May 19: The child hanged and killed in the 2nd floor of the bedroom.

data.title: В детском саду в Душанбе погиб ребенок. Воспитательницу задержала прокуратура
data.description: В частном детском саду столицы погиб двухлетний мальчик. По данным  управления МВД  по городу Душанбе, трагедия произошла 19 мая: ребенок задохнулся, оказавшись подвешенным на решетке двухъярусной кровати.    Следствие установило, что воспитательница оставила детей без присмотра во время дневного сна – в момент происшествия ее не было в спальной комнате.
data.translatedTitle: A child died in a kindergarten in Dushanbe. The teacher was detained by the prosecutor's office
data.translatedDescription: In the private kindergarten of the capital, a two -year -old boy died. According to the Office of the Ministry of Internal Affairs in the city of Dushanbe, the tragedy occurred on May 19: the child suffocated, being suspended on a bunk bed.    The investigation found that the teacher left the children unattended during a daytime - at the time of the incident there was no in the sleeping room.

data.title: Cabral abriu a mão de todo o conforto que tinha na altura (em Lisboa e em Bissau), e decidiu dar sua vida para o seu povo. Lutou para acabar não só com a miséria, mas também para dar educação ao seu povo, um sonho que felizmente brotou e hoje podemos contar com quadros qualificados. Por isso é triste e vergonhoso constatar que alguns desses ditos “quadros qualificados” são gananciosos e outros são bajuladores
data.description: António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13
data.translatedTitle: Cabral opened the hand of all the comfort he had at the time (in Lisbon and Bissau), and decided to give his life to his people. He fought to end not only with misery, but also to giving education to his people, a dream that fortunately sprouted and today we can count on qualified pictures. So it is sad and shameful to realize that some of these so -called “qualified pictures” are greedy and others are flatterers

data.title: DSP o Maquiavélico Ganancioso
data.description: Guineenses, mais uma vez, venho para vos alertar sobre o perigo que Domingos Simões Pereira representa para a Guiné-Bissau. Faço esse alerta a todos os guineenses sem exceção que se encontre no país ou no estrangeiro, ao PAIGC em especial e na pessoa do Cipriano Cassamá em concreto. Alerta esse sobre o verdadeiro DSP, o verdadeiro espírito que move esse sujeito, o qual alguns ainda continuam a acreditar para não dizer adorar. Domingos Simões Pereira é um manipulador, um verdadeiro chantagista e calculista provavelmente, tipo de comportamento que ultrapassa o nível de psicopata. U m ambicioso desmedido, um verdadeiro criminoso que sabe como e quando cometer o crime. Ele jamais coabitaria não só com JOMAV, assim como com qualquer presidente que seria eleito, a não ser o que ele apoiou disfarçadamente. Isto porque ele tem sua própria agenda, e o PAIGC é simplesmente uma plataforma para sua concretização. DSP jamais coabitaria com JOMAV porque o seu candidato preferido era o Paulo Gomes e sempre será, o qual juntamente com Tchitchi vão delineando mecanismo de modo a serem os novos donos da Guiné-Bissau. Segundo eles este é um processo a médio prazo, e é preciso coragem e paciência para concretiza-lo. Ganhar o congresso não importa em que circunstância e ter novamente o partido na mão, é uma fase concluída em proveito deles, enquanto verdadeiros militantes do PAIGC estão a bater palmas. Depois dessa eleição legislativa, não importa o resultado, o Cipriano Cassama que se prepare a mala ou fica de bico fechado, pois o candidato preferido para o partido será o Paulo Gomes, e esse sim deve ter a voz dentro do partido. DSP é um ambicioso desmedido, nunca teve consideração por ninguém, JOMAV muito menos, o sujeito é um maquiavélico nato, Cipriano Casama será descartado quando menos esperar podes tomar a nota. Guineenses, falar do Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi é falar do MCCI e demais outras organizações e personalidades camufladas no nosso país. Esses dois indivíduos são os principais financiadores do MCCI e demais outras personalidades boca de aluguel na cidade de Bissau. O MCCI, Milícia idealizado por JBV e DSP, agora financiado e dirigido por "futuro triângulo do poder" ou seja, "DSP, Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi", têm 3 principais objectivos: 1º Perturbar a ordem pública em nome da cidadania, difamar e tentar descredibilizar qualquer que seja organizações ou indivíduos não alinhados ao triângulo, de modo a suportar suas caminhadas na busca do poder. 2º Caso se concretize o objectivo do triângulo, o papel da Milícia do MCCI passará a ser de vigilância constante a todos os adversários de modo a garantir falsa paz social e o poder de controlo. 3º Tentar ganhar credibilidade junto das organizações internacionais e regionais, através de suas visitas e actividades de fachada, para quando houver as tais actividades de perturbações de ordem pública, poderem ganhar notoriedade. Mas isso não deve preocupar ninguém, pois estão bem identificados e bem caçados, dentro e fora da Guiné-Bissau. Não tenho nada contra ninguém, mas quem continuar a perturbar verdadeira paz social dos guineenses em troca de benefícios como sempre foi nos últimos anos dessa crise, e que sempre tenho tolerado, então que fique claro "estou firme e determinado para tudo e todos". Para finalizar, gostaria de vos deixar uma reflexão com a seguinte frase: " Domingos Simões Pereira é um perigo grave para o futuro do país ". Isto porque publicar aqui tudo que é necessário para provar ou sustentar a razão dessa frase, só pode agravar ainda mais a paz social que tanto necessitamos. Chega, chega não podemos continuar a viver nessa turbulência vida toda, meus irmãos guineenses, não é saudável, é tóxico, não é justo para um povo que tanto sofreu. data.title: DSP, UM PERIGO GRAVE PARA FUTURO DO PAÍS
data.description: Os meios de comunicação também são as formas de manipulação mais utilizadas pelos poderes políticos, dado o seu impacto social. As informações são manipuladas não apenas tendo em vista omitir factos relevantes, mas também distorcer o conteúdo da informação veiculada, produzir ou forjar a opinião pública, de modo que a mesma se ajuste às ideias dos gananciosos. A única forma dos cidadãos evitarem cair nestes processos de manipulação é tornarem-se mais vigilantes em relação às instituições democráticas e aos órgãos de informação, adoptando uma atitude de permanente reflexão crítica sobre a informação que lhes é fornecida. Na Guiné-Bissau, nos últimos anos, cresceu exponencialmente o número de pessoas mediocres, pessoas sem escrúpulos ligadas à produção de rádios e outros meios de comunicação com influencia na nossa sociedade, gente que apesar da sua enorme influência na sociedade, trabalha na mais completa impunidade e sem qualquer controlo ético/democrático. Obcecado pelo poder, ciente da dificuldade do povo guineense em avaliar informações, ciente do poder dos instrumentos de comunicação, Domingos Simões Pereira (DSP) nunca menosprezou esses instrumentos para atingir seu objectivo, sempre usou-os de forma desonesta como agora está a fazer tudo por tudo para manter no controlo desses veicúlos, mesmo que isso custe a vida dos outros. Governou na corrupção, no nepotismo e no desvios de somas astronómicas do dinheiro de povo, que muito serviria para investimentos na saúde, educação e outros serviços publicos, para beneficiar familiares e amigos. Finge que preocupa com os problemas do país, mas só engana o povo honesto, humilde e trabalhador que infelizmente sofre muito, não sei até quando, devido a sua paciência e tolerância aos governantes como DSP, criminoso travestido em politico que vive na custa de povo e acima de tudo ainda fa-lo refem do próprio suor. Roubou e decepcionou tanto não só aos guineenses assim como a comunidade internacional que sempre acreditou que o sujeito era ideal para ajudar esse povo a sair do ciclo de sofrimento que parece infinito. Foi demitido, não conformou e está a fazer tudo na medida do possível para continuar a complicar a vida dos guineenses. Razão disso é que depois de perder a batalha nos meios de comunicações mais modernos nomeadamente os blogues onde investiu grandes somas do dinheiro de povo, para fazer a lavagem cerebral dos menos instruídos e não só. Fugiu do facebook onde sempre frequentava e comunicava com todos tentado passar a mensagem de um politico moderno e aberto a diálogo/opiniões, mas que afinal era simplesmente um falso modernista. Caiu a mascara e já não consegue enganar ninguem, pois a sua credibilidade está abaixo de zero, para não dizer outra coisa. Camaradas, para conhecimento geral, com o dinheiro roubado que custou suor de povo guineense, DSP decidiu avançar com um outro novo plano maquiavelico, para criar a sua própria estação de rádio. Documento António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13
data.translatedTitle: DSP, a serious danger to the country's future
data.translatedDescription: The media are also the most used forms of manipulation by political powers, given their social impact. The information is manipulated not only in view of omitting relevant facts, but also distorting the content of the information conveyed, producing or forging public opinion, so that it adjusts to the ideas of the greedy. The only way for citizens to avoid falling into these manipulation processes is to become more vigilant in relation to democratic institutions and information bodies, adopting an attitude of permanent critical reflection on the information provided to them. In Guinea-Bissau, in recent years, the number of mediocre people has grown exponentially, unscrupulous people linked to the production of radios and other media with influence on our society, people who despite their enormous influence on society, work on more complete impunity and without any ethical/democratic control. Obsessed with power, aware of the difficulty of the Guinean people in evaluating information, aware of the power of communication instruments, Domingos Simões Pereira (DSP) has never belittled these instruments to achieve their goal, always used them dishonestly how it is now doing everything to keep in control of these vehicles, even if it costs the lives of others. data.title: Ramadhin adviseert op lijsttrekkers te stemmen
data.description: Politiek analist Hardeo Ramadhin waarschuwt kiezers om bij de verkiezingen op 25 mei liever op de lijsttrekker van hun partij te stemmen, om zo fouten op het stembiljet te voorkomen. “Anders is de kans groot dat het biljet ongeldig wordt verklaard,” aldus Ramadhin in het programma De Tafel van Suriname Herald en Rasonic TV. Bij de vorige verkiezingen werden circa 5000 stemmen ongeldig verklaard - bijna genoeg voor een zetel.
data.translatedTitle: Ramadhin recommends voting on party leaders
data.translatedDescription: Political analyst Hardo Ramadhin warns voters to prefer to vote for their party's party leader in the elections on 25 May, in order to prevent mistakes on the ballot. "Otherwise there is a good chance that the note will be declared invalid," said Ramadhin in the program De Tafel van Suriname Herald and Rasonic TV. In the previous elections, around 5000 votes were declared invalid - almost enough for a seat.

data.title: Kasi Trading maakt herstart met verzilvering Foodvouchers
data.description: Kasi Trading, gevestigd aan de Livorno Beekhuizenweg, is in overleg met de bevoegde instanties, opnieuw gestart met de verzilvering van eerder uitgegeven Foodbasket-vouchers. Dit gebeurde op maandag 19 mei. De herstart biedt belangrijke steun voor veel gezinnen in Beekhuizen, Livorno en omliggende wijken. De voucher vertegenwoordigt een waarde van SRD 1000.
data.translatedTitle: Kasi Trading makes restart with cashed in food vouchers
data.translatedDescription: Kasi Trading, located at Livorno Beekhuizenweg, has started again in consultation with the competent authorities with the cash in Food Basket vouchers. This happened on Monday 19 May. The restart offers important support for many families in Beekhuizen, Livorno and surrounding neighborhoods. The voucher represents a value of SRD 1000.

data.title: Gráfico de la semana: precios de las materias primas en caída
data.description: El Banco Mundial anticipa contracciones adicionales para el precio de los commodities , que se extenderían tanto a 2025 como a 2026. El dato En su último informe de perspectivas, el Banco Mundial proyecta una caída de 12,4% para los precios de las materias primas este año, que se explica por la retracción del precio de los commodities energéticos (17,4%) y alimenticios (7%), y también por los metales y minerales (9,8%). The data in its latest perspective report, the World Bank projects a 12.4%drop for the prices of raw materials this year, which is explained by the retraction of the price of energy commodities (17.4%) and food (7%), and also by metals and minerals (9.8%). data.title: Más de 300.000 personas estaban fuera del radar de las políticas públicas, advirtió especialista
data.description: El economista Matías Brum aseguró a la diaria que la nueva metodología que implementa el INE para medir la pobreza demostró que “las luces rojas de la pobreza infantil se agravaron y ahora se volvieron púrpuras”. La situación es particularmente crítica entre niñas, niños y adolescentes. La nueva medición de la pobreza en Uruguay evidencia una realidad más dura de lo que se creía. Con los cambios metodológicos implementados por el Instituto Nacional de Estadística (INE), la cantidad de personas en situación de pobreza pasó de 296.743 a 617.403, lo que supone una compleja situación para el gobierno de Yamandú Orsi. data.translatedDescription: Economist Matías Brum assured the newspaper that the new methodology implemented by the INE to measure poverty showed that "the red lights of child poverty worsened and now they turned purple." The situation is particularly critical between girls, boys and adolescents. The new measurement of poverty in Uruguay shows a harder reality than was believed. With the methodological changes implemented by the National Institute of Statistics (INE), the number of people in poverty went from 296,743 to 617,403, which means a complex situation for the Yamandú Orsi government. data.title: El Parlamento de Italia aprobó una ley que dificulta el acceso a la ciudadanía a los descendientes de italianos
data.description:
Con la nueva legislación la nacionalidad únicamente le será concedida a quien tenga uno de los padres o de los abuelos “exclusivamente italiano”. La Cámara de Diputados italiana aprobó una nueva ley por 137 votos a favor, 83 en contra y dos abstenciones, que modifica las condiciones para que los descendientes de inmigrantes italianos puedan acceder a obtener la ciudadanía de sus ancestros. La decisión, tomada el martes, valida el texto que ya había sido aprobado por el Senado a mediados de mayo, concluyendo así el trámite legislativo.
... Continuar leyendo...
data.translatedTitle: The Parliament of Italy approved a law that hinders access to citizens to the descendants of Italians
data.translatedDescription:
With the new legislation, nationality will only be granted to those who have one of the parents or grandparents "exclusively Italian". The Italian Chamber of Deputies approved a new law by 137 votes in favor, 83 against and two abstentions, which modifies the conditions for the descendants of Italian immigrants to access to obtain the citizenship of their ancestors. The decision, taken on Tuesday, validates the text that had already been approved by the Senate in mid -May, thus concluding the legislative process.
